snippet: Altaf Hussain, the leader of Kirachi’s dominant political party, was released on bail four days after his arrest in Britain on allegations of money laundering.
abstract: British police release Pakistani political leader Altaf Hussain, four days after he was arrested on suspicion of money laundering, but say inquiry will continue; investigation stems in part from seizure of at least $600,000 in cash during raids on Hussain’s home and office in 2012 and 2013.
lead_paragraph: Altaf Hussain, the leader of Kirachi’s dominant political party, was released on bail four days after his arrest in Britain on allegations of money laundering.

headline.print_headline: Britain Frees Pakistani in Financial Inquiry
